New Records: Dylan Crews became the first Nationals rookie to hit a home run in back-to-back games since Alex Call (Sept. 8-9, 2022 at St. Louis and Philadelphia)
Key Match Events: Dylan Crews hit his second Major League home run in the third inning
CJ Abrams drew a crucial ninth-inning walk in a 2-2 count to load the bases in a late rally
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Martinez said he wants Abrams to relax and slow down a little bit, and gave him a breather by moving him to the No. 7 spot in the batting order
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Martinez said 'We're going to play hard for the last out of the game, and they did that tonight.'
CJ Abrams said 'I just want to give him a little breather, I want him to relax a little bit, start working better at-bats.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nationalsâ€™ momentum of winning the series against the Yankees was halted by a 7-6 defeat to the Cubs on Friday at Nationals Park
The Nats fought back with a three-run ninth-inning rally that fell short
